section.title: Install and configure controller node
section.para: This section describes how to install and configure the Compute service, code-named nova, on the controller node.

procedure.title: To configure prerequisites
procedure.para: Before you install and configure Compute, you must create a database and Identity service credentials including endpoints.

step.para: To create the database, complete these steps:
Use the database access client to connect to the database server as the root user:
Create the nova database:
Grant proper access to the nova database:

screen.userinput: GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON nova.* TO 'nova'@'localhost' IDENTIFIED BY 'NOVA_DBPASS';
GRANT ALL PRIVILEGES ON nova.* TO 'nova'@'%' IDENTIFIED BY 'NOVA_DBPASS';

step.para: Replace NOVA_DBPASS with a suitable password.
Exit the database access client:
Source the admin credentials to gain access to admin-only CLI commands:
To create the Identity service credentials, complete these steps:
Create the nova user:
Replace NOVA_PASS with a suitable password and EMAIL_ADDRESS with a suitable e-mail address.
Link the nova user to the service tenant and admin role:
Create the nova service:
Create the Compute service endpoints:

screen.userinput: keystone endpoint-create \ --service-id $(keystone service-list | awk '/ compute / {print $2}') \ --publicurl http://controller:8774/v2/%\(tenant_id\)s \ --internalurl http://controller:8774/v2/%\(tenant_id\)s \ --adminurl http://controller:8774/v2/%\(tenant_id\)s

procedure.title: To install and configure Compute controller components

step.para: Install the packages:

screen.userinput: apt-get install nova-api nova-cert nova-conductor nova-consoleauth \ nova-novncproxy nova-scheduler python-novaclient
yum install openstack-nova-api openstack-nova-cert openstack-nova-conductor \ openstack-nova-console openstack-nova-novncproxy openstack-nova-scheduler \ python-novaclient

zypper install openstack-nova-api openstack-nova-scheduler \ openstack-nova-cert openstack-nova-conductor openstack-nova-console \ openstack-nova-consoleauth openstack-nova-novncproxy python-novaclient

step.para: Edit the /etc/nova/nova.conf file and complete the following actions:
In the [database] section, configure database access:
Replace NOVA_DBPASS with the password you chose for the Compute database.
In the [DEFAULT] section, configure RabbitMQ message broker access:
step.programlisting: [DEFAULT] ... rpc_backend = rabbit rabbit_host = controller rabbit_password = RABBIT_PASS
step.para: Replace RABBIT_PASS with the password you chose for the guest account in RabbitMQ.
In the [keystone_authtoken] section, configure Identity service access:
step.programlisting: [keystone_authtoken] ... auth_uri = http://controller:5000/v2.0 auth_host = controller auth_port = 35357 auth_protocol = http admin_tenant_name = service admin_user = nova admin_password = NOVA_PASS
step.para: Replace NOVA_PASS with the password you chose for the nova user in the Identity service.
In the [DEFAULT] section, configure the my_ip key to use the management interface IP address of the controller node:
